intro: Eriocaulon nakasimanum var. superans, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a grass-like plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in tropical and subtropical regions. It has a compact growth form with dense, tufted foliage. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems and a subject of study in botanical research.
